We actually stayed in the room although they offered to change us the next morning. For the price and free parking ( our old hotel charges $15 per night which quickly adds up on our two week stays ) many quick food options within walking distance and a drug store on the corner you really cannot beat the value. Again, because it is so economical, you might find guests with loud children or less than mannered guests who scream and laugh outside your door, but that is not often and easily forgiven for the extra money we take shopping. There's a Food for Less just across the road for groceries, plenty of Thai restaurants nearby and also all the popular names like Subway, Starbucks, McDonalds and 7-11 are close.  After a full day out we found it like a home away from to home to come back to our room.  The carpark is tight but Ash, the manager, has it worked out with fitting everyone's car in and letting people out.  If you're looking for a comfortable place to stay on a budget and in a good location then this just may be the place for you.

reviews.text: An enjoyable stay at this hotel.  The room booked was a non smoking double sized room with two comfortable double beds. The room was great as a base, clean and complete with fridge, air con and a TV (with some decent stations like HBO, AMC and the usual networks). The wifi was great to begin with (they give you the password on checking in), but they changed provider during our stay, and was good but unfortunately wasn't as reliable as earlier.    Had minimal contact with staff, but any requests were dealt with promptly and with a minimal of fuss.    No meals, but there is complimentary coffee/tea from the check in desk area.    The location on W Sunset Blvd is great. The Hollywood Western Metro station is only a couple of blocks away, so great for getting around (only a couple of stops from Hollywood Blvd and Universal Studios). A Food4Less is across the road, ideal for stocking up the fridge. A pharmacy is also next door. There are plenty eateries along the road, from McDonalds, to a couple of Denny's and other diners. Enough to eat out differently each day of the week. And go far enough along Sunset Blvd and there is the chance to shop your socks off, with stores like Amoeba Music, Meltdown Comics, Staples, Home Depot and more.
